posts.post_content:
Sanguine bond and this.
  
Say you're on 10 life, the opponent still on 20.
  
Play this ability with a sanguine bond out and as such this ability is classed as a life gain/life loss, they will lose 10 life, whilst you gain 10, they then lose another 10.
  
game.

Poor p/t and no ability such as shroud or haste makes this card kind of useless at turn 6.  
I think [Corrupt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corrupt) or other cards can do better job.  
Interesting combos can be used with this guy like pay infinite life with [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel) or giving [Abyssal Persecutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abyssal Persecutor) to opponent.   
3.5/5 for interesting ability . .

posts.post_content:
The reason why this isn't better than [Mirror Universe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Universe) is because [Mirror Universe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Universe) could be played in any colored deck. This is a black spell, which is only playable in Black-colored EDH.   
  
Not only that, but a creature is much easier to kill than an Artifact.  
  
The point of the Magus' was to go back to Magics originally beastly non-creature permanents and put them in a creature. They were made to be worst than the card they were copying. Do not ever consider rating this higher than their non-Magus counterparts.
posts.html:
The reason why this isn't better than Mirror Universe is because Mirror Universe could be played in any colored deck. This is a black spell, which is only playable in Black-colored EDH.

Not only that, but a creature is much easier to kill than an Artifact.

The point of the Magus' was to go back to Magics originally beastly non-creature permanents and put them in a creature. They were made to be worst than the card they were copying. Do not ever consider rating this higher than their non-Magus counterparts.
